fullText: The show works best when it focuses on Summer's personal journey from gospel-singing teenager LaDonna Adrian Gaines to international superstar, rather than getting bogged down in clunky attempts to address social issues.
dtliExcerpt: The show works best when it focuses on Summer's personal journey from gospel-singing teenager LaDonna Adrian Gaines to international superstar, rather than getting bogged down in clunky attempts to address social issues.
bwwExcerpt: Sadly, that's one of the few decent jokes in this tacky little show, a feebly dramatized Wikipedia page with lackluster covers, which was rushed to Broadway following a fall tryout at La Jolla Playhouse that received mostly tepid reviews. And yet it shows no sign of improvements having been attempted. Heaven knows it's not the way it should be.
